result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:30 AM Defendant Andrea L Schaefer in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
Attorney Masnica to enter a plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
The Court will set the matter in front of the Trial Court to enter that plea.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Andrea L Schaefer in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is stipulating to the findings in the competency report. Defendant indicates she believes she is competent.  Matter to be set for preliminary hearing.   Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Competency report dated 04-27-2022, from Dr. Deborah Collins
Signed by Commissioner David Herring on 03-31-2022
Review hearing on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

10:54 AM Defendant Andrea L Schaefer in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for review on competency.  Review hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Attorney Nicole Masnica

Adjustment Number: 22A 012764,

Receipt Number: 22R 013424,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key unless it is for emergency purposes only or if Victim A initiates contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.

01:00 PM Defendant Andrea L Schaefer in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
